meanings.definition: A small, portable device used to shield oneself from rain.
meanings.sent1: I always carry my umbellet in my bag when it's cloudy.
meanings.sent2: She opened her colorful umbellet when the rain started.
meanings.sent3: The umbellet saved the day when unexpected rain poured down.
meanings.sent4: Her umbellet was like a tiny roof protecting her from the raindrops.
meanings.sent5: The bright red umbellet stood out in the sea of umbrellas.

meanings.definition: To cover or protect with an umbellet.
meanings.sent1: He umbelleted himself from the rain with a large umbrella.
meanings.sent2: She umbellets her plants during heavy storms to keep them safe.
meanings.sent3: The magician umbelleted the audience with a shower of confetti.
meanings.sent4: The mother umbelleted her child with a warm blanket on the cold night.
meanings.sent5: The knight umbelleted the princess with his shield during the battle.

meanings.definition: The act of carrying an umbellet in case of rain.
meanings.sent1: Having an umbellet in your handbag is always a good idea.
meanings.sent2: She never forgets her umbellet whenever she goes out in the rain.
meanings.sent3: The umbellet dance competition was a fun event in the park.
meanings.sent4: The umbellet parade brightened up the gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The umbellet fashion show showcased the latest designs in rain protection.
